content: Executive Chairman & Chief Medical Officer Tunji Alausa, M.D. is a board-certified Nephrologist and the founder of both Kidney Care Center, a nephrology practice and Dialysis Care Center, a rapidly growing provider of boutique dialysis services nationwide. Dr. Alausa has created these national brands focusing on optimal care for patients with chronic kidney disease in underserved communities. He has made a remarkable contribution to these communities by creating numerous job opportunities for diverse stakeholders. Additionally, he has established a team of highly skilled professionals across the country who share his vision and mission.Dr. Alausa served as a Chief Medical Resident at Cook County Hospital, Chicago, after completing his residency in Internal Medicine. In this role, he supervised the training of several interns and residents and acted as an Attending Physician. Later, he joined Rush University Medical School as an Assistant Professor. He then moved to the Medical College of Wisconsin for his specialist training in Nephrology and Hypertension.Dr. Alausa has been recognized with multiple awards for his charitable contributions and voluntary service to those in need, which is a testament to his philanthropic spirit. He has published numerous medical papers covering a diverse range of practices.
title: Leadership - Dialysis Care Center
